summary: This document is a daily lieutenant's log from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, NY, dated July 17, 2019. It details routine prison operations, inmate counts, movements, and security checks across three shifts (Morning, Day, and Evening Watch). It notes several inmates on special observation statuses, including suicide watch and psychological observation, and records inmate transfers to and from court, hospital, and other units.

events.title: Daily Prison Operations and Inmate Movements
events.description: Routine security checks, inmate counts, and numerous inmate transfers between housing units, court, hospital, and general population at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The log documents prison operations on July 17, 2019, the date Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell; however, his name is not explicitly mentioned in this excerpt.
Several inmates are listed under 'Daily Sensitive Information' on special statuses: one on Psychological Observation, two on Suicide Watch (each with an inmate companion), and one at a local hospice.
Inmate Paul Manafort (#35207-016) is recorded as being transferred within the facility, indicating he was an inmate at MCC New York at the time.
The log shows routine but detailed security protocols, including body alarm tests, metal detector checks, roof checks, and inmate counts conducted every few hours.
One inmate, Gouldbourne, was placed in Administrative Detention at 8:15 PM pending an investigation.
